Original Text: An immigrant was told he could visit home He was arrested at the airport Ricardo Velázquez was caught in a scam that also ensnared more than 100 others after his immigration attorney lied to him More than two decades ago Ricardo Velázquez immigrated to the US from Puebla Mexico since then he has spent most of the time since working in kitchens while dreaming of gaining a visa that would let him visit his home town with his familyEarly this year his former immigration attorney Kofi Amankwaa gave him the news he had long been waiting for his travel application had been approved The lawyer claimed Velázquez could freely visit Mexico with his family embrace his parents and see his children interact with their grandparents in person rather than through a screen Continue reading

Original Text: Mark Cavendish wins final stage of Giro dItalia as Roglic takes overall victory Geraint Thomas finishes second to Primoz Roglic in standingsCavendish wins sprint in final Giro stage before retirementMark Cavendish marked his last appearance at the Giro dItalia with a sensational sprint victory in the final stage surging over the line to seal a fairytale finish for the ManxmanThe 38yearold who announced earlier in the race that he will retire from cycling at the end of the season was helped to victory by his fellow Briton Geraint Thomas who saw his dreams of overall Giro victory dashed by Primoz Roglic on Saturday Continue reading

Original Text: Max Verstappen wins wet Monaco F1 GP to stretch world championship lead Fernando Alonso second Esteban Ocon completes podiumVerstappen leads Sergio Pérez by 39 points in driver standingsMax Verstappen won the Monaco Grand Prix taking a poletoflag victory dominating a race where he was unchallenged at the front of the field But what had opened with another tiresome procession on the streets of Monte Carlo delivered intense late drama as rain engulfed the principalityRed Bulls Verstappen nonetheless comfortably beat the Aston Martin of Fernando Alonso into second Esteban Ocon was third for Alpine Lewis Hamilton and George Russell in their newly upgraded Mercedes finished in fourth and fifth Continue reading

Original Text: Rublev in action Evans out Tsitsipas through French Open day one  live Updates from the openingday action at Roland GarrosKostyuk hits back at boos after snubbing SabalenkaGet in touch Email Daniel or tweet him with your thoughtsKostyuk is a decent player too  she got to round four last term  and at 20 will get better Her tough luck to get this draw and Saba tells Fabrice shes delighted and appreciates the crowds support  she had initially thought it was her they were jeering She says the win in Australia was huge for her but she thought her first major would be Roland Garros  shes not sure why It meant a lot that she beat Swiatek in the Madrid final and gave her the confidence to think she can make something happen hereAnother terrific performance from Saba who meets Udvardy or Shymanovich next The Ukrainian Kostyuk refuses to shake hands with the Belarusian Sabalenka and the crowd boo her Continue reading

Original Text: Mauricio Pochettino signs contract to become Chelsea head coach until 2026 Argentinian manager to start job next week at Stamford BridgeOfficial announcement from club expected in the coming daysMauricio Pochettino has signed a threeyear contract to become the new Chelsea head coach The Argentinian is in Spain but expects to start at Stamford Bridge next week with the official announcement on his appointment expected in the coming daysChelsea have been looking for a new manager since firing Graham Potter last month Pochettino verbally agreed to accepting the job earlier this month and will be the third permanent manager to work under the Todd BoehlyClearlake capital ownership since they bought the club last year Continue reading

Original Text: Carlisle promoted to League One after beating Stockport in Wembley shootout Carlisle returned to League One after edging past Stockport on penalties in a battle of endurance at Wembley to clinch their first promotion for 17 years Tomas Holys save from Ryan Rydel enabled the substitute Taylor Charters to score the winning penalty and spark wild jubilation for the Cumbrians after their long journey southStockport appeared to be on course for backtoback promotions after Jon Mellishs firsthalf own goal Carlisle left it late but Omari Patricks 84th minute goal forced extra time For the second day in a row the playoff final was decided on penalties but while the Hatters of Luton delivered in the shootout on Saturday their namesakes Stockport fell agonisingly short Continue reading
Translated Text: Carlisle promoted to League One after beating Stockport in Wembley shootout Carlisle returned to League One after edging past Stockport on penalties in a battle of endurance at Wembley to clinch their first promotion for 17 years Tomas Holys save from Ryan Rydel enabled the substitute Taylor Charters to score the winning penalty and spark wild jubilation for the Cumbrians after their long journey southStockport appeared to be on course for backtoback promotions after Jon Mellishs firsthalf own goal Carlisle left it late but Omari Patricks 84th minute goal forced extra time For the second day in a row the playoff final was decided on penalties but while the Hatters of Luton delivered in the shootout on Saturday their namesakes Stockport fell agonisingly short Continue reading

Original Text: French Open Kostyuk calls out crowd who booed her for snubbing Sabalenka Ukrainian refuses handshake after Belarusians 63 62 winI didnt expect it People should honestly be embarrassedThe Ukrainian Marta Kostyuk believes the French Open crowd should be embarrassed after they booed her off court at Roland Garros when she refused to shake hands with Aryna Sabalenka following the Belarusians 63 62 win in the first round of the French OpenSince Russia began its invasion of Ukraine last year which has been supported by Belarus Ukrainian players have opted not to shake hands with Russian and Belarusian opponents after their various meetings As Kostyuk walked directly to shake the umpires hand however a significant portion of the crowd on Court Philippe Chatrier immediately booed Continue reading

Original Text: PSG goalkeeper Sergio Rico in intensive care after horse riding accident 29yearold was riding in Spain after team clinched league titleSpaniard also had spells at Fulham Sevilla and MallorcaParis SaintGermain goalkeeper Sergio Rico is in intensive care after a horse riding accident the club said on SundayThe Ligue 1 champions confirmed Spanish media reports that Rico PSGs secondchoice goalkeeper is in the ICU at Sevillas Virgen del Rocio hospital According to local media Rico was riding when he collided with a runaway horse and was thrown from his mount He was taken to hospital by helicopter Continue reading
Translated Text: PSG goalkeeper Sergio Rico in intensive care after horse riding accident 29yearold was riding in Spain after team clinched league titleSpaniard also had spells at Fulham Sevilla and MallorcaParis SaintGermain goalkeeper Sergio Rico is in intensive care after a horse riding accident the club said on SundayThe Ligue 1 champions confirmed Spanish media reports that Rico PSGs secondchoice goalkeeper is in the ICU at Sevillas Virgen del Rocio hospital According to local media Rico was riding when he collided with a runaway horse and was thrown from his mount He was taken to hospital by helicopter Continue reading

Original Text: Saracens sunkissed win over Sale tempered by crisis at London Irish Onfield product is good and Englands players shone with the World Cup looming but rugby union still faces serious issuesEven in Saracens moment of triumph on Saturday their director of rugby Mark McCall admitted to mixed feelings A first Premiership title since the salary cap saga that sent his club spiralling into the Championship ranked among his most satisfying achievements but this week could also bring a gloomy postscript if his old team London Irish become the third financially stricken club to be suspended from the leagueMcCall is the smartest of operators and one whose determination to drive Sarries back to the top of the domestic game never left him even in their darkest hours He is also among those however keenly aware of the reputational damage done to the league when established names such as Wasps Worcester and now potentially Irish disappear in a puff of debtheavy smoke Its hard to be jubilant when these things are happening the Ulsterman said I love London Irish and it would be awful if that happens Continue reading
Translated Text: Saracens sunkissed win over Sale tempered by crisis at London Irish Onfield product is good and Englands players shone with the World Cup looming but rugby union still faces serious issuesEven in Saracens moment of triumph on Saturday their director of rugby Mark McCall admitted to mixed feelings A first Premiership title since the salary cap saga that sent his club spiralling into the Championship ranked among his most satisfying achievements but this week could also bring a gloomy postscript if his old team London Irish become the third financially stricken club to be suspended from the leagueMcCall is the smartest of operators and one whose determination to drive Sarries back to the top of the domestic game never left him even in their darkest hours He is also among those however keenly aware of the reputational damage done to the league when established names such as Wasps Worcester and now potentially Irish disappear in a puff of debtheavy smoke Its hard to be jubilant when these things are happening the Ulsterman said I love London Irish and it would be awful if that happens Continue reading

Original Text: England should pull plug if Zak Crawley falters again against Ireland  Mark Ramprakash England have shown faith in their players but the batter has been given a long run without showing consistencyEnglands summer begins at Lords against Ireland on Thursday and even if it is only a starter before the lavish main course of the Ashes I am sure nobody in that dressing room will be taking it lightly It is after all a Test at the home of cricket a big crowd a big game and there is lots of competition in the squadSeveral players will remember the game against Ireland in 2019 when my old Middlesex teammate Tim Murtagh got five for 13 and England were bowled out for 85 before lunch on the first day I am pretty sure that was a oneoff  theres a reason Tim is approaching 1000 firstclass wickets and if you give him the right conditions hell exploit them  but the players will want to make absolutely certain Continue reading

Original Text: BillamSmith proves point in front of home fans to take Okolies title Bournemouth fighter becomes WBO cruiserweight championOkolie knocked down several times before losing on pointsChris BillamSmith is the new World Boxing Organisation cruiserweight world champion after defeating the previously unbeaten Lawrence Okolie who was knocked down three times and also docked two points for his ugly and excessive brawlingTwo of the judges had BillamSmith a comprehensive winner by margins of 116107 and 115108 while the third official bizarrely decided it was a 112112 draw It was a ridiculous score and the first two judges at least captured the mayhem of Okolies desperate tactics and the controlled discipline of BillamSmith who deserved all the plaudits Continue reading

Original Text: Olympic champion Ryan Crouser shatters own shot put world record Crouser breaks own world mark with 2356m throw in LAUS sprint star ShaCarri Richardson among scratches in 100mOlympic and world shot put champion Ryan Crouser produced a sensational performance to obliterate his own world record at the Los Angeles Grand Prix on SaturdayThe 30yearold American star heaved a mammoth 2356m throw at Drake Stadium to smash his previous world mark of 2337m set at the US Olympic trials in Eugene in 2021 Continue reading

Original Text: If anyone can we can Luton Town prepare for life in the Premier League Amid celebrations in Las Vegas CEO Gary Sweet will be getting the ground ready to welcome Erling Haaland and coAs bank holiday weekends go this one will surely prove tricky for Luton Town supporters to top On Saturday they returned after a Wembley penalty shootout to the top table of English football for the first time since 1992 and on Sunday the towns colourful carnival took centre stageMonday A promotion parade at St Georges Square where a frenzied atmosphere is a given On Thursday the players will ramp up the celebrations by flying to Las Vegas Continue reading

Original Text: Lutons giddy promotion fulfils long dream of returning to the elite  Paul MacInnes One half of Wembley was a sea of orange as this 170m match showed it was about more than just money for both teamsTen minutes after Rob Edwards had been brought to a halt halfway around Wembley celebrating furiously a goal that was shortly disallowed the Luton manager was to be found victorious but calm as still water His first action on winning the playoff final was to hug his opponent Mark Robins Around this tender scene was pure chaos his players haring about embracing and hurling each other to the ground like so many 6fttall puppy dogs Promotion its a hell of a drugLuton Town are a Premier League club and international broadcast packages can now finally be cut probing the various tiny entrances to Kenilworth Road For the Hatters there is joy hope and  especially for the players  the chance to change their lives For Coventry whose disconsolate players stood motionless for 15 minutes after the end of a penalty shootout which featured 11 kicks scored and one ballooned horribly over the bar there will currently  but not permanently  be sorrow Continue reading
Translated Text: Lutons giddy promotion fulfils long dream of returning to the elite  Paul MacInnes One half of Wembley was a sea of orange as this 170m match showed it was about more than just money for both teamsTen minutes after Rob Edwards had been brought to a halt halfway around Wembley celebrating furiously a goal that was shortly disallowed the Luton manager was to be found victorious but calm as still water His first action on winning the playoff final was to hug his opponent Mark Robins Around this tender scene was pure chaos his players haring about embracing and hurling each other to the ground like so many 6fttall puppy dogs Promotion its a hell of a drugLuton Town are a Premier League club and international broadcast packages can now finally be cut probing the various tiny entrances to Kenilworth Road For the Hatters there is joy hope and  especially for the players  the chance to change their lives For Coventry whose disconsolate players stood motionless for 15 minutes after the end of a penalty shootout which featured 11 kicks scored and one ballooned horribly over the bar there will currently  but not permanently  be sorrow Continue reading

Original Text: Sheffield Wednesday and Barnsley aim to keep skyhigh level at Wembley The South Yorkshire rivals who finished the season on 96 and 86 points meet in Mondays League One playoff finalHow do you top a soaring giddying high that most Sheffield Wednesday fans may not have experienced in their lifetimes On Monday their team will try although there may be no replicating the feeling they engendered upon overhauling a 40 firstleg deficit against Peterborough to reach the League One playoff final A straightforward win could feel prosaic by comparison but the prize on offer at Wembley is impossible to play down promotion would be the first crucial step in heaving a storied institution from the doldrumsIt will require one last monumental effort and even then there is no guarantee a fine Barnsley side will buckle The 80th iteration of this South Yorkshire derby will contain more spice than any of its predecessors and it is a reminder too of the sky high standards set in this seasons third tier Wednesday finished with 96 points and would not have believed anyone who back in August suggested that tally would not secure automatic promotion even Barnsleys total of 86 points in coming fourth would have earned a toptwo spot in three of the last 10 seasons Continue reading

Original Text: Flint and ORiordan strikes seal Scottish Womens Cup for Celtic against Rangers Womens Scottish Cup final Rangers 02 CelticGoalscorers Flint 64 ORiordan 67Celtic retained the Scottish Womens Cup with a convincing 20 win against Rangers at Hampden Park The first time the teams had met in the final was also the first time the game was hosted at the national stadiumSecondhalf goals from Natasha Flint and Claire ORiordan secured victory for a Celtic side who posed more of an attacking threat throughout It was Malky Thomsons final game in charge of Rangers before he returns to coach the academy but his side who secured the Sky Sports Cup this season came up short Continue reading

Original Text: Feeling myself Lutons Tom Lockyer thanks medical staff from hospital bed Club captain collapsed during playoff final victory at WembleyDefender in hospital under precaution and will undergo testsTom Lockyer the Luton captain has thanked medical staff for their swift and thorough response after he collapsed during his sides Championship playoff final victory against CoventryThe defender fell to the floor while running back during the match and received treatment before being carried off the pitch on a stretcher The game went to penalties after Jordan Clarks opener was cancelled out by Gustavo Hamer to finish 11 after extra time and the Hatters secured Premier League football for next season with a 65 victory on penalties Continue reading

Original Text: Paul Konchesky leaves West Ham Women manager role after one year Former England defender leaves a season into his twoyear dealHammers finished eighth but reached Continental Cup semisPaul Konchesky has left his position as West Ham manager after the Womens Super League season ended on Saturday a year after his appointmentThe former England defender who made 70 appearances for the Hammers was promoted from assistant in May 2022 when Olli Harder departed Konchesky signed a twoyear deal but has left the Hammers after just 29 games in charge with the club finishing eighth in the WSL table following a 22 draw at home to their London rivals Tottenham in their final match of the campaign Continue reading

Original Text: Luton promoted to Premier League after shootout victory against Coventry This time Rob Edwards really could celebrate The Luton manager had hared off down the touchline with four minutes of extra time remaining to celebrate what he thought was the winning goal in front of his sides supporters eating up 45 yards of Wembley turf only to retreat to his technical area ashenfaced after glancing up at the big screen confirming Joe Taylors extratime goal which would have been his first for the club had been disallowed for handball Jonathan Panzo on cold as a substitute dawdled on the ball and Taylor a 20yearold making his sixth appearance nicked it from the Coventry defender but surged through on goal with the help of his right handEdwards covered his face in disbelief but after 140 minutes of gripping action an agonising penalty shootout followed Eventually Fankaty Dabo missed the crucial spotkick as Luton clinched promotion to the Premier League at Coventrys expense capping an incredible rise from nonleague to the top flight in nine years It meant Edwards was able to laugh about the disallowed goal afterwards What an idiot he said I thought that was going to come back to haunt me Continue reading

Original Text: Delirium in Liverpool drama voor onze LeicesterBelgen Everton wendt degradatie af op laatste speeldag Leicester en Leeds zakken naar Championship De inzet was hoog voor de start van de laatste speeldag in de Premier League Everton Leicester City en Leeds United speelden alle drie nog voor het behoud Maar nu is de degradatiestrijd beslecht Everton won thuis tegen Bournemouth met het kleinste verschil 10 en verwijst zo Leeds en Leicester dat zelf ook won 21 naar de Engelse tweede klasse Wat betekent dit voor onze landgenoten bij de Foxes

Original Text: Mark Cavendish na spurtwinst in Rome Ik vroeg grappend aan G of hij de lead out wou doen Mark Cavendish kan bij verlies een ettertje zijn maar bij winst is hij de liefste man van de hele wereld En met ouder te worden is hij ook emotioneler Geraint Thomas is zo apart Hij ziet altijd een glas halfvol in de plaats van halfleeg

Original Text: Van Eetvelt sluit met twee etappezeges en eindzege in Alpes Isère Tour moeilijke periode af Kan het volledig achter mij laten Na de vierde etappe heeft Lennert Van Eetvelt Lotto Dstny ook de vijfde en laatste rit gewonnen van de Franse Alpes Isère Tour een rittenkoers van het UCIniveau 22 Daarmee stelde hij ook de eindzege veilig Met twee ritzeges én het eindklassement laat de 21jarige Van Eetvelt een moeilijke historie achter zich in zijn eerste koers na een vermeende inbreuk op de dopingreglementen die om een administratief misverstand bij het gebruik van een neusspray bleek te gaan
Translated Text: Van Eetvelt closes with two stage zeges and finish victory in Alpes Isère Tour difficult period Can it be completely behind me After the fourth stage, Lennert Van Eetvelt Lotto Dstny also won the fifth and final ride of the French Alpes Isère Tour a race race of the UCI level 22 With that he secured the final victory With two rides and the final classification, the 21 year old Van Eetvelt leaves behind a difficult history in his first course after an alleged infringement of the doping regulations which proved to be an administrative misunderstanding in the use of a nasal spray

Original Text: Rebecca F Kuang rejects idea authors should not write about other races US fantasy novelist talks of weird kind of identity politics in American publishing while at Hay festivalThe author of Babel and The Poppy War Rebecca F Kuang has said she finds the idea that authors should only write about characters of their own race deeply frustrating and pretty illogicalSpeaking at the Hay festival the author who was born in China but moved to the US when she was four said that there is a really weird kind of identity politics going on in American publishing She is sympathetic to an extent as it is coming from decades of frustration of seeing the same racist uncritical underresearched shallow stereotypes Continue reading

Original Text: UK ministers discuss voluntary price limits for basic foods but rule out imposing caps Scheme would be at retailers discretion says government following talks between PM and chancellor and the food sectorMinisters are working with supermarkets to voluntarily cap the price of basic food items in an effort to ease the UKs cost of living squeeze but insists it is not considering imposing price capsWith food and drink prices rising at the fastest pace in more than 40 years and no letup in sight the Treasury and supermarkets have been discussing a possible voluntary scheme for maximum prices for certain goods These would be likely to include essentials such as bread and milk Continue reading

Original Text: US seeks to fine January 6 rioters to claw back donations they raked in Prosecutors are asking judges to impose fines on top of prison sentences to offset donations from supporters of Capitol riotersLess than two months after he pleaded guilty to storming the US Capitol on January 6 2021 Texas resident Daniel Goodwyn appeared on Tucker Carlsons then Fox News show and promoted a website where supporters could donate money to Goodwyn and other rioters whom the site called political prisonersThe justice department now wants Goodwyn to give up more than 25000 he raised  a clawback that is part of a growing effort by the government to prevent rioters from being able to personally profit from participating in the attack that shook the foundations of American democracy Continue reading
Translated Text: US seeks to fine January 6 rioters to claw back donations they raked in Prosecutors are asking judges to impose fines on top of prison sentences to offset donations from supporters of Capitol riotersLess than two months after he pleaded guilty to storming the US Capitol on January 6 2021 Texas resident Daniel Goodwyn appeared on Tucker Carlsons then Fox News show and promoted a website where supporters could donate money to Goodwyn and other rioters whom the site called political prisonersThe justice department now wants Goodwyn to give up more than 25000 he raised  a clawback that is part of a growing effort by the government to prevent rioters from being able to personally profit from participating in the attack that shook the foundations of American democracy Continue reading

Original Text: Southampton and Liverpool share eight goals in seesaw draw on day of farewells Pack up the euphoniums lay down the drumsticks put away the trumpets If they thought that the Premier League would last for ever they were wrong There is always something slightly mournful about the prekickoff playing of When the Saints Going Marching In and perhaps never more so than on Sunday with the brass band hinting it could be one of the casualties of the costcutting that will inevitably follow relegation The chaotically defiant entirely unfunereal performance that followed does not change thatThat is the sad truth when a team goes down The players the firstteam coaches and the directors will by and large be fine Fans may weep but for all the selfpity of a subset of modern support most will be back next season happy enough at a day out with family or friends whoever the opposition The people who suffer are those in less visible roles the academy coaches the analysts the catering staff and  perhaps  the brass band Thats where the cuts fall and where they are felt Continue reading
Translated Text: Southampton and Liverpool share eight goals in seesaw draw on day of farewells Pack up the euphoniums lay down the drumsticks put away the trumpets If they thought that the Premier League would last for ever they were wrong There is always something slightly mournful about the prekickoff playing of When the Saints Going Marching In and perhaps never more so than on Sunday with the brass band hinting it could be one of the casualties of the costcutting that will inevitably follow relegation The chaotically defiant entirely unfunereal performance that followed does not change thatThat is the sad truth when a team goes down The players the firstteam coaches and the directors will by and large be fine Fans may weep but for all the selfpity of a subset of modern support most will be back next season happy enough at a day out with family or friends whoever the opposition The people who suffer are those in less visible roles the academy coaches the analysts the catering staff and  perhaps  the brass band Thats where the cuts fall and where they are felt Continue reading

Original Text: I dont respect her Kostyuk hits out at Sabalenka and French Open crowd  video Ukraines Marta Kostyuk believes the French Open crowd should be embarrassed after they booed her off court at Roland Garros when she refused to shake hands with Aryna Sabalenka following the Belarusians 63 62 win I want to see people react in 10 years when the war is over They will not feel really nice about what they didKostyuk added that she does not respect Sabalenka and accused the world No 2 of not using her platform to speak out against Russias invasion of Ukraine which is supported by Belarus Just to reject her responsibility of having an opinion on the most important things in the world  I cant respect thatSabalenka responded to Kostyuks comments saying I said many times nobody  Russian or Belarusian athletes  support the war Of course we dont support war If we could stop it we would  but its not in our handsFrench Open Kostyuk calls out crowd who booed her for snubbing Sabalenka Continue reading

Original Text: Trippiers own goal earns Chelsea draw against Newcastle after Gordon opener While the players of Newcastle United stood in front of the noisy band of travelling supporters and celebrated qualifying for the Champions League for the first time since 2002 their counterparts in blue made a slightly sheepish beat around the Stamford Bridge pitch and wondered what comes next after the season from hell finally came to an endThe immediate answer was a fond farewell to Frank Lampard after his unsatisfactory stint as caretaker ended in a lively 11 draw with Newcastle Yet in the longer term Chelsea know they are in for a long rebuild They have finished in the bottom half for the first time since 1996 and their owners Todd Boehly and Clearlake Capital will have little to celebrate when they mark the oneyear anniversary of their takeover of the club tomorrow Even news of Mauricio Pochettino signing his deal to become Chelseas new manager will have to be checked against the reality that the months ahead could be long painful and extremely costly Continue reading

Original Text: Everton seal Premier League survival as Doucouré screamer sinks Bournemouth Everton extended Abdoulaye Doucourés contract earlier this week and the midfielder repaid them by extending their residence in the top flight of English football into a 70th year The midfielder struck a quite superb goal to seal the victory Sean Dyches team desperately needed over Bournemouth to avoid a first relegation since 1951It was a tense nerveracking finish at Goodison Park where 10 minutes of added time an injury to Jordan Pickfords hand and the stubborn refusal of Gary ONeils side to go quietly combined for a chaotic end to the season When it was finally over Doucouré etched his name alongside the likes of Barry Horne Graham Stuart and Gareth Farrelly as Everton last day saviours and Dyche had completed a fine achievement with an imbalanced squad that has spent the majority of the campaign without a proven goalscorer Continue reading

Original Text: Leicester relegated from Premier League despite beating West Ham For Leicester City never has a win felt so utterly crushing Victory over West Ham on the final day of the season was insufficient to avoid relegation to the Championship seven years on from lifting the Premier League title here and two on from winning the FA Cup Leicester supporters frantically refreshed their phones and a couple had transistor radios glued to their ears as they prayed for a late twist in their favour at Goodison Park but it was not forthcoming Twentyfour hours earlier Leicesters women avoided relegation on the final day but a repeat proved wishful thinkingThings had all been going so well for Leicester until news of Abdoulaye Doucourés goal for Everton filtered through here Harvey Barness fine firsthalf goal paved the way to victory but suddenly a revvedup crowd were decidedly flat silenced as reality set in A couple of minutes later Saïd Benrahma rattled a post and any hope of a late great escape was nearly all over there and then The beaming smile on the face of Wout Faes after the defender headed in a Youri Tielemans freekick to double Leicesters lead felt somewhat cruel Who was going to tell him Continue reading

Original Text: Leeds relegated from Premier League after losing to Tottenham It was the moment when it really turned ugly the fury and frustration that the Leeds support felt rushing to the surface and spilling everywhere Pedro Porro had scored at the start of the second half to put Tottenham 20 up and from all corners of Elland Road came the cry Youre not fit to wear the shirtLeeds had needed a miracle to retain their Premier League status A first win in nine games and the results involving Everton and Leicester to go for them too They had needed to find some cohesion And they needed to defend properly which they have not done for an awfully long time Continue reading

Original Text: Aston Villa secure European spot with Ollie Watkins on target against Brighton When the fixtures for this season were released it was a song no one expected to hear on the final day at Villa Park But as the celebrations began at the sound of the final whistle supporters of both sides joyously launched into a most unlikely rendition Were all going on a European tour they happily sang to one anotherWhere Brightons first European venture in their 122year history was assured prior to this match Villa ensured they will join them on the continent courtesy of this hugely entertaining win A campaign that initially looked to be dominated by thoughts of the Championship extraordinarily ended with a spot in the Europa Conference League  a first European involvement since 2010 Continue reading

Original Text: Pinnocks winner consigns Manchester City to finalday defeat at Brentford Manchester City may be just 180 minutes from history and will be thankful the final 90 of their Premier League season passed without incident bar Brentford becoming the only team to do the double over themEthan Pinnocks goal was came late the ball nodded into his path by Bryan Mbeumo after Kevin Schades cross and it crowned a fine season for Brentford Jeopardy had already been removed Brentford relying on Aston Villa and Tottenhams results to potentially seize the outside chance of crowning the finest season in the clubs modern history with a place in next seasons Europa Conference League Continue reading

Original Text: Arsenal and Granit Xhaka bow out in style with easy win over Wolves A day to celebrate reinvention and regeneration found the perfect way to mark those qualities Arsenal are unrecognisable from the club that spent half a decade toiling beneath the elite and Granit Xhaka in his final game for them supplied a poetic reminder of his own redemption arc Parallels can be drawn between the recovery of Xhakas credibility under Mikel Arteta and that of his flourishing team here all parties played the hits and as signoffs go it could hardly have been more appropriateXhakas impending move to Bayer Leverkusen is an open secret but this was a clear heartfelt farewell message played out in public When he opened the scoring after 11 minutes it felt like a pleasant bow with which to wrap up a second goal straight afterwards felt too good to be true and anyone requiring more should have been sated shortly after the halfhour Presented with a glorious chance to complete his hattrick Xhaka completely fluffed a halfvolley in front of goal Once upon a time that brand of mishap would have met boos this time there were chuckles from an audience who have learned to accept their midfielder warts and all Continue reading
Translated Text: Arsenal and Granit Xhaka bow out in style with easy win over Wolves A day to celebrate reinvention and regeneration found the perfect way to mark those qualities Arsenal are unrecognisable from the club that spent half a decade toiling beneath the elite and Granit Xhaka in his final game for them supplied a poetic reminder of his own redemption arc Parallels can be drawn between the recovery of Xhakas credibility under Mikel Arteta and that of his flourishing team here all parties played the hits and as signoffs go it could hardly have been more appropriateXhakas impending move to Bayer Leverkusen is an open secret but this was a clear heartfelt farewell message played out in public When he opened the scoring after 11 minutes it felt like a pleasant bow with which to wrap up a second goal straight afterwards felt too good to be true and anyone requiring more should have been sated shortly after the halfhour Presented with a glorious chance to complete his hattrick Xhaka completely fluffed a halfvolley in front of goal Once upon a time that brand of mishap would have met boos this time there were chuckles from an audience who have learned to accept their midfielder warts and all Continue reading

Original Text: Latvia shock USA to win their first ice hockey world championship medal Kristian Rubins scores in overtime to seal 43 victoryAmericans lose bronze medal game for second straight yearDefenseman Kristian Rubins scored his second goal 122 into overtime to lead Latvia to a 43 victory over the United States and earn a bronze medal at the ice hockey world championship on SundayIts the first topthree finish for Latvia at the tournament Their previous best was seventh place something they have achieved three times Continue reading

Original Text: Evans suffers shocking French Open first round defeat against Kokkinakis Briton beaten 64 64 64 by Australian opponent in ParisThere will be plenty of soulsearching  Its disappointingDan Evans said he will have ample soulsearching to do after his hopes of a positive French Open ended with a dispiriting 64 64 64 defeat against Thanasi Kokkinakis in the first roundI said the other day theres some soulsearching said Evans the 20th seed referencing his recent criticism of British tennis There will be plenty of that tonight Got to get on and try and get my game in a good spot Its shocking right now how I played today Its disappointing I thought I was in a good spot coming in but I felt like that the whole time Its not good enough Continue reading

Original Text: Met police to stop attending emergency mental health calls Exclusive move will come into force on 31 August and will only be waived if a threat to life is fearedPolice in London will no longer attend emergency calls related to mental health incidents the Metropolitan police commissioner has ruledIn a letter seen by the Guardian Sir Mark Rowley says he will order his officers not to attend thousands of calls they get every year to deal with mental health incidents Continue reading

Original Text: Van galajurken met teenslippers tot een hele modeshow de mode tijdens Cannes filmfestival Naast de films wordt elk jaar reikhalzend uitgekeken naar de mode tijdens het filmfestival in Cannes Met Donatella Versace die besloot haar laatste collab met Dua Lipa tijdens het festival voor te stellen krijgt het steeds meer de allures van een heuse modeweek
Translated Text: From gala gurneys with flip flops to a whole fashion show the fashion at Cannes Film Festival Besides the movies, fashion is eagerly looked forward to every year at the Cannes Film Festival With Donatella Versace who decided to present her last collab with Dua Lipa during the festival, it gets more and more the allure of a true fashion week.

Original Text: Wereldrecord langste robotketen ooit gevestigd op festival Nerdland Onderzoekers en academici van de VUB en van het onderzoekscentrum imec zijn erin geslaagd om samen met de bezoekers van het Nerdland Festival een plek te veroveren in het Guinness World Records het vroegere Guinness Book of Records Ze maakten een keten van 334 zelfontworpen robots
Translated Text: World record longest robot chain ever established at festival Nerdland Researchers and academics of the VUB and of the research center imec have managed to join the visitors of the Nerdland Festival in the Guinness World Records the former Guinness Book of Records They made a chain of 334 self-designed robots

Original Text: Ajacied Berghuis geeft fan ferme klap in Enschede krijgt boete en betuigt spijt Steven Berghuis heeft zondag na de wedstrijd FC TwenteAjax een ferme klap uitgedeeld aan een omstander De aanvaller van Ajax kon zich vlak voor het instappen van de spelersbus niet inhouden en haalde hard uit Hij heeft inmiddels een boete gehad van Ajax en spijt betuigd
Translated Text: Ajacied Berghuis gives fan firm blow in Enschede gets fine and regrets Steven Berghuis gave a firm blow to a bystander on Sunday after the game FC TwenteAjax couldn't resist just before getting on the player's bus and pulled out He has now had a fine from Ajax and expressed regret

Original Text: The Little Mermaid hooks audiences with whale of an opening weekend The liveaction remake brought in nearly 100m over the Memorial Day weekend knocking Fast X out of the top spotThe Little Mermaid liveaction remake of Disneys 1989 animated classic made a splash at the box office on Memorial Day weekend bringing in almost 100m in North America according to studio estimates released on SundayThe film starring Halle Bailey winning praise from critics as the titular mermaid Ariel and Melissa McCarthy as her sea witch nemesis Ursula ranks as the fifth biggest Memorial Day weekend opening on record Continue reading

Original Text: Eddie Jones enjoys winning return as skilful Barbarians outscore World XV Barbarians 4842 World XVIsrael Folau is roundly booed after antigay comments in 2019Boos again on Eddie Joness return to Twickenham but this time directed only at Israel Folau The former Australia wings selection for the World XV raised eyebrows given the controversy his antigay social media posts caused in 2019 and he was regularly jeered by the Twickenham crowd He scored a try showcasing his unquestionable talent but suffice to say he was persona non grata in southwest LondonJones meanwhile escaped unscathed on his first trip back to Twickenham He played down the significance but it was almost six months to the day after his final England match ended in resounding boos and the axe soon followed He never liked this fixture but after this you sense his opinion has changed There can be no doubt that he enjoyed his triumphant return Taking charge of the Barbarians he flashed up on the big screen just after Seta Tamanivalus try had sealed an entertaining victory against Steve Hansens World XV Jones was beaming grinning from ear to ear cream secured Continue reading
Translated Text: Eddie Jones enjoys winning return as skilful Barbarians outscore World XV Barbarians 4842 World XVIsrael Folau is roundly booed after antigay comments in 2019Boos again on Eddie Joness return to Twickenham but this time directed only at Israel Folau The former Australia wings selection for the World XV raised eyebrows given the controversy his antigay social media posts caused in 2019 and he was regularly jeered by the Twickenham crowd He scored a try showcasing his unquestionable talent but suffice to say he was persona non grata in southwest LondonJones meanwhile escaped unscathed on his first trip back to Twickenham He played down the significance but it was almost six months to the day after his final England match ended in resounding boos and the axe soon followed He never liked this fixture but after this you sense his opinion has changed There can be no doubt that he enjoyed his triumphant return Taking charge of the Barbarians he flashed up on the big screen just after Seta Tamanivalus try had sealed an entertaining victory against Steve Hansens World XV Jones was beaming grinning from ear to ear cream secured Continue reading

Original Text: Opluchting nadat twee verdachten zijn opgepakt voor de moord op Tamara 33 één van de daders had een huissleutel Op sociale media wordt opgelucht gereageerd nu er twee verdachten zijn opgepakt voor de dood van Tamara Engels 33 uit SintNiklaas Volgens het OostVlaamse parket werd de vrouw allicht slachtoffer van een roofmoord en waren de daders uit op geld en haar laptop Dank aan de politie die de daders kon vaten schrijft haar vader op Facebook
Translated Text: Relieved after two suspects were arrested for the murder of Tamara 33 one of the offenders had a house key Social media is relieved when two suspects were arrested for the death of Tamara Engels 33 from SintNiklaas According to the East Flemish parquet, the woman was probably the victim of a robbery and the perpetrators were after money and her laptop Thanks to the police who could barrel the perpetrators wrote her father on Facebook

Original Text: La multipremiada cantante de jazz Cécile McLorin Salvant llega a Castellón Cultura a través del Instituto Valenciano de Cultura IVC presenta este fin de semana dos grandes propuestas en el Auditori de Castelló El sábado 27 de mayo el ciclo Auditori Jazz Club presenta una de las grandes voces del jazz internacional Cécile McLorin Salvant El domingo 28 de mayo será el turno del espectáculo La fábula de la ardilla dirigido a todas las familias El delegado territorial del IVC en Castellón Alfonso Ribes ha destacado que Castellón sigue siendo un referente dentro de la programación regular de jazz gracias a las grandes figuras internacionales y del territorio No sólo en la capital de la Plana porque también organizamos el Festival Internacional de Jazz de Peñíscola que este verano llega a la edición número 20 y que presentaremos los próximos días ha dichoDisfrutar de un concierto de una artista con la categoría de McLorin en Castellón es una oportunidad e invito a toda la ciudadanía que no se lo pierda ha enfatizado Ribes La personalidad de esta artista criada en Miami trasciende géneros e influencias Cécile McLorin Salvant es una vocalista de jazz con una carrera hasta ahora fulgurante ya que solo con treinta y tres años ya ha conseguido tres premios Grammy prácticamente consecutivos El último trabajo de Salvant Ogresse fusiona géneros como el folk barroco jazz y country El tour internacional de McLorin recae en el Auditori de Castelló y continuará durante las próximas semanas por países como Holanda Polonia Alemania Japón Reino Unido o China Las entradas para este concierto tienen un precio de 15 euros y se pueden adquirir en la taquilla electrónica del IVCAdemás el Auditori de Castelló presenta este domingo 28 de mayo a las 1800 horas el espectáculo familiar La fábula de la ardilla La producción de La Peonza y dirección de Jokin Oregi es una invitación a pensar reflexionar y profundizar en la diferencia y el mestizaje La pieza presenta un gran erizo que vive plácidamente a la sombra de un gran roble y cuida a los suyos mientras disfruta de su pedacito de mundo Pero un día esta paz se ve perturbada por la llegada de una ardilla amable traviesa y juguetona Su convivencia no será fácil Se descubirá un erizo arisco y protector y una ardilla con ganas de saber y compartir El espectáculo está dirigido a mayores de 3 años Las entradas tienen un precio de 4 euros y se pueden adquirir en la taquilla electrónica del IVC
Translated Text: The multipremière jazz singer Cécile McLorin Salvant arrives at Castellón Cultura through the Instituto Valenciano de Cultura IVC presents this weekend two great proposals in the Auditori de Castelló On Saturday 27 May the cycle Auditori Jazz Club presents one of the great voices of the international jazz Cécile McLorin Salvant On Sunday 28 May will be the turn of the show The fable of the squirrel addressed to all the families The territorial delegate of the IVC in Castellón Alfonso Ribes has emphasized that Castellón continues to be a reference within the regular programming of jazz thanks to the great international figures and the territory Not only in the capital of the Plana because we also organize the International Festival of Jazz of Peñíscola that this summer arrives to the edition number 20 and that we will present the next days has saidEnjoy of a concert of an artist with the category of McLorin in Castellón is an opportunity and invite to all the citizenry that has not missed it Ribes The personality of this artist maid in Miami transcends genres and influences Cécile McLorin Salvant is a vocalist of jazzy with a career until now three years.

Original Text: Wereldleiders feliciteren Erdogan met herverkiezingen Logisch resultaat Verschillende wereldleiders hebben in de loop van de avond hun felicitaties aangeboden aan de vertrekkende Turkse president Recep Tayyip Erdogan in sommige gevallen zelfs nog voor de officiële bekendmaking van de resultaten door de Turkse Hoge Verkiezingscommissie YSK Dit was met name het geval voor de Franse president Emmanuel Macron en de Russische president Vladimir Poetin
Translated Text: Congratulations to world leaders Erdogan with reelections Logical result During the evening several world leaders have offered their congratulations to outgoing Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in some cases even before the official announcement of the results by the Turkish High Election Commission YSK This was particularly the case for the French President Emmanuel Macron and Russian President Vladimir Putin

Original Text: Erdogan wint Turkse presidentsverkiezingen We zullen samen zijn tot aan het graf Recep Tayyip Erdogan 69 mag zich nog eens vijf jaar president van Turkije noemen Hij riep zondagavond al zelf de overwinning uit in een toespraak nadat hij in de voorlopige uitslagen meer dan 50 procent van de kiezers achter zich kreeg Later op de avond werd hij officieel uitgeroepen tot winnaar
Translated Text: Erdogan wins Turkish presidential elections We will be together until the grave Recep Tayyip Erdogan 69 may call himself President of Turkey another five years He declared victory on Sunday evening in a speech after he got more than 50 percent of the voters behind him Later in the evening he was officially declared winner

Original Text: 95 procent van de stemmen geteld Erdogan staat aan de leiding In Turkije zijn de stembureaus zondag omstreeks 16 uur onze tijd gesloten De Turkse president Recep Tayyip Erdogan staat aan de leiding in de tweede ronde van de presidentsverkiezing met 95 procent van de stemmen die al geteld zijn Dat meldt het officiële agentschap Anadolu
Translated Text: 95 percent of the votes counted Erdogan is in charge In Turkey, polling stations are closed at 4 p.m. on Sunday. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is in charge in the second round of the presidential election with 95 percent of the votes already counted. That's what the official agency Anadolu reports.

pena

Original Text: Dusan Djordjevic beëindigt zijn carrière met driepunter en twaalfde titel met Oostende Zon afscheid is buiten alle verwachtingen In stijl zette Dusan Djordjevic zaterdagavond een punt achter zijn carrière Twee maanden na zijn 40ste verjaardag vierde hij met vijfduizend Oostendse supporters Magic 12 Twaalf jaar baskette Djordjevic voor Oostende en hij vierde evenveel Belgische landstitels Een perfect afscheid van een legende

Original Text: Burriana Venecia y Hollywood Durante la mayor parte del siglo XX los vagones del vapor de vía estrecha transportaron mercancías y pasajeros de Vilareal a Burriana y viceversa Más o menos esto es lo que hacemos aquí con las historias y sus protagonistas Desaparecida La Panderola las dos poblaciones han mantenido vivos los vínculos de vecindad no exenta de cierta rivalidad Así aún se escucha repetir a los vilarrealenses que ellos iban a pie o en bicicleta hasta Burriana para cobrar la narnaja mientras los burrianenses acudían a Vilareal subidos en automóviles de lujo a liquidar sus deudas Seguramente que esto pasó como pasó aquel tren Y lo mismo pasó con el proyecto de la moderna vía que tenía que comunicar el puerto de Burriana con el interior de la provincia Esa carretera sería la salida directa al mar de la comarca del Alcalatén Para ello además de habilitar la infraestructura portuaria que promovió el diputado Chicharro tuvo que levantarse un imponente puente de cinco ojos en el sector del Termet de Vilareal No obstante dicha carretera se detuvo allí justo al otro lado del río frente a Torre AnitaComo se recordará este chalet era propiedad de la familia Parra y fue la residencia de verano del cardenal Tarancón por esto se la conocía también con el sobrenombre de Parragandolfo Solo se tenía que atravesar el imponente puente del Mijares para reconocer entre naranjos la silueta negra de aquel príncipe de la Iglesia Incluso se intuía que estaba en la casa por el humo del Montecristo que prendía de la comisura de sus labios una suerte de fumata bianca menos densa que la que anuncia a los nuevos papas Tarancón no renunciaba al placer de un buen puro habano ni a una copa de Cardenal Mendoza dos marcas que según afirmaba con ironía eran propias de su gremio Él sin proponérselo fue el camino que unió su Burriana natal con la Torre de los retiros Estas fueron las moradas que frecuentó en los horas de descanso convirtiéndolas en el nexo invisible entre la marededéu de la Misericòrdia y la de Gràcia Y si bien se piensa este par de advocaciones marianas simbolizan los pilares básicos de su largo pontificado una compasión misericordiosa hacia el prójimo y la dosis justa de gracia y socarronería valencianas A quienes no les hacía tanta gracia era a los ultras aquellos que pintaban en las paredes de Madrid Tarancón al paredón y Aún nos queda dinamita para volar Torre AnitaLos viejos vilarrealenses a la desembocadura del río todavía la nombran con el apelativo de la mar de Vilareal Sin duda es una apropiación indebida pues no se encuentra en su municipio No obedece únicamente el anhelo por poseer unos pocos metros del Mediterráneo sino porque allí en la ribera y marina del delta fluvial al final del camino de las alquerías de Santa Bárbara se situó la gran finca de Polo de Bernabé En la partida burrianense estableció su pionera Colonia Agrícola del Mijares con la mayor extensión de cítricos de la Plana Después de la hacienda se deshizo su manirrota hija la Pola qui compra planta i qui ven arranca Más tarde a principios del siglo XX César de Prat y Dasi barón de Almolda adquirió La Pola y en ella levantó la casona señorial que rebautizó como El Palasiet un nombre más adecuado al ringorrango de su nuevo dueño Se podría decir que la construcción de esta corrieron paralelas al momento de mayor expansión económica de Burriana una particular Belle Époque que introdujo el gusto por el art nouveau Ese fue el tiempo en que se acuñó el lema propagandístico Burriana París y Londres al que los naturales de las localidades vecinas contestaban con la coletilla sarcástica i per on passes tenfrondres por firme de sus calles No obstante El Palasiet se erigió ajeno al modernismo como si hubiera estado plantado en medio del jardín desde el barrocoMás allá del tópico vinculado a la exportación naranjera el barón también miraba de puertas afuera Pero no a la Ville Lumiere ni a la capital británica como los comerciantes sino a la península itálica como los clásicos Y es que la edificación y los ornamentos de El Palasiet respondían a la idea de un palazzo De allí eran la fuente de mármol de Carrara las columnas salomónicas de la terraza y los altorrelieves de los ventanales Y también procedían de Italia las góndolas que fondearon en el embarcadero del Mijares El barón de esta manera quiso asimilar su finca a un paisaje de la Toscana y el río Mijares al Gran Canal Así él y sus invitados con máscara podían celebrar unos carnavales venecianos sin salir del término de Burriana La otra posesión eminente del entorno del río fue La Cotorra Esta en lugar de transportarnos a Venecia París o Londres nos lleva directos al Hollywood de la Metro Y es que La Cotorra fue la segunda residencia del pianista valenciano José Iturbi En su finca él se evadía del glamour en la meca del cine y se escapaba con la secretaría Si a orillas del Pacífico frecuentaba a Sinatra Grayson o Kelly y se interpretaba a sí mismo en el papel del maestro Iturbi Y lucía su nombre en letras de oro dentro una estrella en el Paseo de la Fama Él mismo copió la idea y dejó impresas sus huellas en un poyo del chalet borrianense Y junto a estas las de su inseparable secretaria Marion y las del perro CarracucaAquí a orillas del Mijares simplemente tenía que ser el sinyo Pepe el paisano que volvía de hacer las Américas subido en su Rolls Royce Y el músico que ofrecía recitales con motivo de la riada Por eso el alcalde de la época como reconocimiento a tan ilustre veraneante no quiso quedarse atrás a la hora de honrarlo y aunque no tuviera un boulevard como el de Los Ángeles decidió dedicarle una calle principal La Tanda Entonces el operario encargado de grabar la placa escribió Calle San José IturbiNi Tarancón logró ser santo subito tan raudo en ascender a los altares Eso sí Iturbi igual que subió al nomenclátor también bajó A modo de desagravio el Ayuntamiento de Burriana le regaló la placa en la que lo habían santificado
Translated Text: Burrian Venice and Hollywood For the most part of the 20th century the narrow track steam wagons transported goods and passengers from Vilareal to Burrian Venice and Hollywood Burrian Venice and Hollywood For the most part of the 20th century the narrow track steam steam wagons transported goods and passengers from Vilareal to Burriania and vice versa More or less this is what we do here with the stories and their protagonists Missing La Panderola the two towns have kept alive the links of neighborhood not exempt from a certain rivalry of a certain rivalry of a certain rivalry. So it is still heard to repeat to the Vilarrealenses that they went on foot or by bicycle to Burrian to collect the narnaja while the Burundians went to Vilareal the two towns have kept alive in luxury cars to settle their debts. Surely this happened as the train happened. And the same thing happened with the project of the modern road that had to communicate the port of Burrian with the interior of the province. That road stopped right there to the other side of the river opposite to Torre Aita Tower.How it will be remembered this villa was owned by the Parra family and it was the summer of the residence of the summer residence of the Cardinal.

Original Text: Vota Recuerden ustedes bien esta palabra porque en los próximos quince días la van a escuchar hasta la saciedad Hoy ha dado inicio la campaña electoral municipal y autonómica la undécima de nuestra democracia Pero no por llevar más de cuarenta años eligiendo a nuestros alcaldes y alcaldesas la campaña va a ser más serena y consecuenteTodo lo contrario En estas elecciones el resultado va a ser realmente ajustado y como pasa en casi todos los comicios apenas un 5 o un 10 de los votantes va a ser la clave para conocer el resultado finalQue nuestra sociedad está polarizada es un hecho indiscutible y está campaña va a sacar a relucir todos los defectos más desagradables de los que peca nuestra esfera pública y de los que se ha impregnado también la gente de la calleEl debate de candidatos que se celebró el pasado miércoles promovido por la Asociación para el desarrollo de la comunicación AD Comunica se convirtió en una estampa de lo que será la campañaLos candidatos hilvanaban sus discursos en dos líneas clarísimas La que es imprescindible para una campaña que se precie y que se fundamenta en la iteración de promesas y buena voluntad Siempre con una pincelada de color con alguna propuesta rocambolesca de discutible viabilidad Pero además todos lucieron una oratoria certera como las flechas de Robin Hood Un discurso enardecido salpicado de consignas partidistas con mantras manidos algunos de ellos incluso muy desfasados en el tiempo que estamos y actitud agresiva y atacante Es el argumentario dirigido a los fieles A los hollingans de cada una de las siglasPorque en estas elecciones si cada candidatoa consigue afianzar el voto de los propios ya tiene mucho adelantado Sin embargo esta verborrea mitinera tiene un efecto contraproducente Lo que es bueno para los exaltados resulta bastante repelente para ese 5 de indecisos Con lo cual saber dosificar esa excitación verbal va a ser clave para rascar en el caladero de los votos decisivosAdemás es llamativo el efecto que el gobierno produce en algunos políticos locales Por un lado el partido socialista se ha sosegado a sabiendas de que si promete lo que no puede cumplir le puede pasar factura y elabora un programa contenido Por otro lado Compromís y Unides Podem parecen haber estados los últimos años en la oposición y continuan en ese espacio victimista en el que solo se sienten cómodos en el enfrentamiento Es su guerraAl otro lado más allá del centro encontramos a un Ciudadanos nadando a duras penas para agarrarse a un salvavidas poco efectivo de ataque al bipartidismo A un PP que ocupa un incómodo centro de la diana porque le caen por todos lados y necesita definir su personalidad Mientras Vox demuestra que la Historia puede repetirse y sigue patrones de otros países vecinosEn definitiva si les gusta el espectáculo preparen las pipas que tenemos 15 días para disfrutar

Original Text: El Edificio Moruno se abre a Otras dimensiones con el arte del MACVAC Los amantes del arte contemporáneo tienen una cita ineludible en el Edificio Moruno del Grao Las instalaciones culturales acogen desde la semana pasada la exposición Otras dimensiones del Museo de Arte Contemporáneo Vicente Aguilera Cerni de Vilafamés MACVAC El espectador podrá descubrir una amplia colección de esculturas de Pepe Beas Inma Coll Maribel Domènech Fanny Galera Sebastià Miralles Manuel Martí Moreno Pilar Sala y Joan Valle que podrán contemplarse durante los próximos cuatro meses en el espacio cultural un edificio que la Autoridad Portuaria de Castellón ha remodelado recientemente para reconvertirlo en un espacio expositivoLa muestra es importante porque pone en valor que el puerto de Castellón es el puerto de toda la provincia y la necesidad de estrechar vínculos para generar también cultura circular tal y como manifestó el presidente de la Autoridad Portuaria de Castellón Enrique Vidal durante la inauguración La exposición que hoy inauguramos supone traer un pedacito de ese museo y también de Vilafamés hasta el Grao y hasta este emblemático Moruno espai cultural dijo Vidal Quien también agradeció al Museo de Vilafamés su predisposición desde un principio para ir de la mano con la Autoridad Portuaria de Castellón Damos un primer paso en una colaboración que estoy convencido resultará muy fructífera para ambas partesTambién agradeció la colaboración de Simetria Por su parte el comisario de la exposición José Luis González ha señalado que colaboraciones como la que brinda el puerto de Castellón son fundamentales para dar a conocer la labor que desarrolla el museo y animó a la ciudadanía a acercarse a disfrutar de la exposición Otras dimensiones muestra las desiguales formas de mirar que puede tener la escultura que nos sitúan ante una verdad insondable la de que la realidad que nos circunda es tan poliédrica que partiendo de la materia en sus diferentes composiciones y la genialidad artística del escultor o la escultora la forma y su equilibrio en el espacio puede tener infinitas maneras de mostrarse Casi siempre como es en este caso desde la belleza estética y la propuesta intelectual que nos hacen los artistas ambas inseparables cuando hablamos de arte Sobre el Museo se inauguró en 1972 siendo el primero que dentro del territorio valenciano abrió las puertas al arte más actual Su puesta en marcha se debe al crítico de arte Vicente Aguilera Cerni que fue su fundador y primer director razón por la cual lleva su nombre Debido a sus especiales particularidades de su contenido y continente el MACVAC está considerado como un referente en el ámbito del arte contemporáneo Pero sobre todo es un museo distinto alejado de las normas canónicas y movido por un espíritu de colaboración e igualdad subrayó el comisario de la muestra

Original Text: La energía de los alimentos y su manera de cocinarlos Pionera en alimentación natural y energética Montse Bradford lleva más de 45 años dedicada a este ámbito y el Palasiet Thalasso Clinic ha sido testigo de la energía que transmiteNacida en Barcelona la además terapeuta de psicología transpersonal se ha nutrido de diferentes culturas pues ha vivido en Japón Francia Estados Unidos e Inglaterra donde estuvo 35 años y en todos esos países ha podido aprender y formar sobre este tipo de alimentación Y es que la profesional tiene dos escuelas una en Inglaterra y otra en Barcelona y ha escrito 9 librosPero qué es la alimentación natural y energética Como explica Bradford se trata de una alimentación consciente basada en productos km 0 es decir de proximidad que nos proporciona nuestra madre tierra Así asegura que los seres humanos somos energía y debemos elegir los alimentos que nos transmiten la energía que necesitamos en cada momento tanto a nivel físico como mental o emocional También afectan en esta energía los estilos de cocción incluso la combinación de los alimentos Así Bradford explica que comer ecológico es solo el 5 mientras que el 95 es cómo hago alquimia en mi cocinaCon todo ello la experta incide en la importancia de entender lo que nuestro cuerpo nos pide en cada momento y nutrirlo de manera adecuada Igualmente Bradford se ha pronunciado sobre una de las técnicas de nutrición que está cobrando cada vez más fuerza el ayuno intermitente En este contexto asegura que hay que hacerlo de forma coherente Y es que no tiene ningún sentido que nos saltemos el desayuno porque al despertarnos nuestro cuerpo necesita energía para empezar a funcionar Por ello aboga por cenar sobre las 1900 horas siempre algo vegetal y ligero y no comer hasta las 1000 horas por la mañana En este escenario defiende una forma de comer basada en desayunar como un príncipe comer como un rey y cenar como un mendigoOtro de los temas más controvertidos del mundo de la nutrición es el eterno debate sobre si algunos alimentos son peligrosos para la salud pues durante años se llevan demonizando los lácteos algunos cereales e incluso las frutas En este ámbito la experta defiende una nutrición sin lácteos puesto que no tiene sentido que consumamos leche de otro mamífero algo que nos puede afectar con la aparición de intolerancias problemas digestivos o de piel Además las frutas se deben consumir siempre entre comidas nunca durante las mismas pues su combinación con otros alimentos puede provocar una auténtica bomba para el estómago
Translated Text: The energy of the food and its way of cooking them also Pionera in natural and energetic food Montse Bradford has been more than 45 years dedicated to this field and the Palasiet Thalasso Clinic has been witness to the energy that transmits Born in Barcelona the plus therapist of transpersonal psychology has been nourished by different cultures since it has lived in Japan France United States and England where it has been 35 years and in all those countries has been able to learn and train on this type of food And is that the professional has two schools one in England and another in Barcelona and has written 9 booksBut what is the natural and energetic food as Bradford explains it is a conscious diet based on products 0 is to say of proximity that our mother earth So it ensures that human beings are energy and we must choose the energy that we need at each time both physical level and mental or emotional It also affects in this energy the styles of cooking even more than the food mix Bradford explains that eating ecological way is only the 5 while the 95 is how I make alchemia in my kitchen

Original Text: Fragmentos fósiles hallados en Castellón arrojan luz sobre un nuevo dinosaurio espinosáurido Un espécimen de dinosaurio de Castellón representa una nueva especie propuesta de espinosáurido según un estudio de la Universitat Jaume I y Grup Guix publicado en la revista Scientific Reports La identificación de una posible nueva especie sugiere que la Península Ibérica pudo haber sido una zona diversa para los dinosaurios espinosáuridos de cuerpo medio a grande y arroja luz sobre el origen y la evolución de los espinosáuridosLos espinosaurios son diferentes grupos de dinosaurios de gran tamaño bípedos y carnívoros Algunos ejemplos conocidos de espinosaurios son el Spinosaurus y el Baryonyx Se cree que los espinosaurios pudieron originarse en Europa y migrar después a África y Asia pero las pruebas de su existencia en España se basan principalmente en restos de dientes fosilizadosEl investigador de la UJI Andrés SantosCubedo y sus compañeros han analizado fragmentos fósiles un hueso de la mandíbula derecha un diente y cinco vértebras descubiertos anteriormente en la Formación Arcillas de Morella y datados en el Barremiense tardío período Cretácico temprano hace entre 127 y 126 millones de años Basándose en los restos los autores estiman que el espécimen mide entre 10 y 11 metros de largo Compararon el espécimen con datos de otros espinosaurios para determinar su relación evolutiva con otras especies y basándose en un análisis comparativo del espécimen con otros espinosáuridos los autores identificaron el espécimen como una nueva especie y un nuevo género de espinosáurido y lo denominaron Protathlitis cinctorrensis Los autores denominaron al género Protathlitis que significa campeón en griego y utilizaron cinctorrensis en el nombre de la especie para hacer referencia a la ciudad Cinctorres en la que se descubrió el espécimenLos autores proponen que esta nueva especie puede indicar que los espinosáuridos aparecieron durante el Cretácico Temprano en Laurasia una gran extensión de tierra en el hemisferio norte con dos subgrupos de especies ocupando Europa occidental Señalan que es posible que los espinosáuridos emigraran posteriormente a África y Asia donde se diversificaron En Europa dominaban los barioniquinos como el Protathlitis mientras que en África abundaban los espinosaurinos como el Spinosaurus
